ca: Les Aventures De Tom Sawyer
en: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer

ca: Mark Twain
en: Mark Twain

ca: PREFACI.
en: PREFACE

ca: La major part de les aventures consignades en aquest llibre succeiren de bo de bo; una o dues són experiments de la meva collita; la resta pertanyen a minyons que m'eren companys d'escola.
en: Most of the adventures recorded in this book really occurred; one or two were experiences of my own, the rest those of boys who were schoolmates of mine.

ca: Huck Finn és tret de la vida real; Tom Sawyer també, pero no d'un individu: és una combinació de les característiques de tres nois que jo vaig coneixer; així és que pertany a l'orde arquitectonic compost.
en: Huck Finn is drawn from life; Tom Sawyer also, but not from an individual--he is a combination of the characteristics of three boys whom I knew, and therefore belongs to the composite order of architecture.

ca: Les estranyes supersticions a les quals hom fa referencia, predominaven totes entre nois i esclaus de l'Oest en el període d'aquesta historia; és a dir, fa trenta o quaranta anys.
en: The odd superstitions touched upon were all prevalent among children and slaves in the West at the period of this story--that is to say, thirty or forty years ago.

ca: Encara que mon llibre s'adreça sobretot al divertiment de nois i noies, espero que aixo no sera causa que el defugin homes i dones, perque part del meu proposit ha estat mirar de fer plaent memoria als adults d'allo que un dia foren, i de com sentiren i pensaren i parlaren, i en quínes singulars empreses s'esmerçaren de vegades.
en: Although my book is intended mainly for the entertainment of boys and girls, I hope it will not be shunned by men and women on that account, for part of my plan has been to try to pleasantly remind adults of what they once were themselves, and of how they felt and thought and talked, and what queer enterprises they sometimes engaged in. THE AUTHOR.

ca: L'AUTOR (Hartford, 1876).
en: HARTFORD, 1876.

en: CHAPTER I

ca: -Tom!
en: "TOM!"

ca: Cap resposta.
en: No answer.

ca: -Tom!
en: "TOM!"

ca: Cap resposta.
en: No answer.

ca: -Que s'ha fet aquest noi? em demano.
en: "What's gone with that boy, I wonder?

ca: Tom!
en: You TOM!"

ca: La vella senyora tira per avall les seves ulleres i mira per damunt elles al volt de la cambra. Després les tira per amunt i sotja sota d'elles.
en: No answer. The old lady pulled her spectacles down and looked over them about the room; then she put them up and looked out under them.

ca: Poques vegades o mai no mirava a través d'elles per una cosa tan petita com és un noi, perque les ulleres eren de cerimonia, i l'orgull de son cor, i cavalcaven per gala i no pas per servei: igual hauria pogut veure a través d'un parell de tapadores d'estufa.
en: She seldom or never looked _through_ them for so small a thing as a boy; they were her state pair, the pride of her heart, and were built for "style," not service--she could have seen through a pair of stove-lids just as well.

ca: Sembla un moment perplexa, i digué, no pas ferotgement, pero tanmateix en veu prou alta perque el parament de la cambra la sentís: -Bé, m'hi jugo qualsevol cosa que si us atrapo us…
en: She looked perplexed for a moment, and then said, not fiercely, but still loud enough for the furniture to hear: "Well, I lay if I get hold of you I'll--"

ca: No acaba la frase, perque en aquell moment estava decantant-se i furgant sota el llit amb l'escombra: així és que necessitava ale per al ritme de les furgades.
en: She did not finish, for by this time she was bending down and punching under the bed with the broom, and so she needed breath to punctuate the punches with.

ca: No desenterra cap cosa sinó el gat.
en: She resurrected nothing but the cat.

ca: -Mai no l'he vist atrapat, aquest noi!
en: "I never did see the beat of that boy!"

ca: Se n'ana cap a la porta oberta i s'hi atura, i sotja entre els emparrats de tomaqueres i herbes tauperes, que constituien el jardí.
en: She went to the open door and stood in it and looked out among the tomato vines and "jimpson" weeds that constituted the garden.

ca: Res de Tom.
en: No Tom.

ca: Així és que ella féu força per alçar la veu fins al grau exigit per la distancia, i crida:
en: So she lifted up her voice at an angle calculated for distance and shouted:

ca: -O-o-o Tom!
en: "Y-o-u-u TOM!"

ca: Sentí una fressa lleu al darrera, i es gira a temps per a agafar un petit minyó per l'extrem de son gec, i aturar la seva fugida. -Té!
en: There was a slight noise behind her and she turned just in time to seize a small boy by the slack of his roundabout and arrest his flight.

ca: Hauria hagut de pensar en aquest recambró.
en: "There! I might 'a' thought of that closet.

ca: Que hi féieu, aquí dins?
en: What you been doing in there?"

ca: -Res.
en: "Nothing."

ca: -Res!
en: "Nothing!

ca: Mireu-vos les mans i mireu-vos la boca.
en: Look at your hands. And look at your mouth.

ca: Que és, aquesta brutor?
en: What _is_ that truck?"

ca: -No ho sé, tia.
en: "I don't know, aunt."

ca: -Bé, jo sí, que ho sé.
en: "Well, I know.

ca: És melmelada: vet aquí el que és.
en: It's jam--that's what it is.

ca: Us he dit quaranta vegades que si no deixaveu la melmelada tranquila us llevaria la pell.
en: Forty times I've said if you didn't let that jam alone I'd skin you.

ca: Deu-me aquell fuet.
en: Hand me that switch."

ca: El fuet fou brandat per l'aire. El perill era desesperat.
en: The switch hovered in the air--the peril was desperate--

ca: -Ui!
en: "My!

ca: Mireu al darrera vostre, tia!
en: Look behind you, aunt!"

ca: La vella senyora es gira arremolinadament, i arrabassa les faldilles cap enfora de l'amenaça; i el minyó fugí tot seguit, s'enfila damunt el clos d'altes estaques, i desaparegué a l'altra banda.
en: The old lady whirled round, and snatched her skirts out of danger. The lad fled on the instant, scrambled up the high board-fence, and disappeared over it.

ca: La tia Polly romangué sorpresa un moment i en acabat esclatá en una dolça rialla.
en: His aunt Polly stood surprised a moment, and then broke into a gentle laugh.

ca: -Diastre de noi! Mireu's que és prou, que jo mai pugui escarmentar!
en: "Hang the boy, can't I never learn anything?

ca: No m'ha fet prou martingales, perque ara m'emprengui de sotjar-lo?
en: Ain't he played me tricks enough like that for me to be looking out for him by this time?

ca: Pero un vell ximple és el pitjor dels ximples.
en: But old fools is the biggest fools there is.

ca: Un gos vell no apren cap traça nova, com diu la dita.
en: Can't learn an old dog new tricks, as the saying is.

ca: Tanmateix, en nom de Déu, ell no s'empesca mai les mateixes coses dues vegades seguides; i com pot coneixer un hom la que ha de venir?
en: But my goodness, he never plays them alike, two days, and how is a body to know what's coming?

ca: Sembla talment que sapiga per quant de temps podra de consumir-me les sangs sense que m'arribi a arborar, i sap que, si arriba a aconseguir de deixar-me en bitza per un minut o fer-me riure, jo m'aplaco i no puc ventar-li patacada.
en: He 'pears to know just how long he can torment me before I get my dander up, and he knows if he can make out to put me off for a minute or make me laugh, it's all down again and I can't hit him a lick.

ca: No hi compleixo pas la meva obligació amb aquest noi; i aquesta és la santa veritat, Déu ho sap.
en: I ain't doing my duty by that boy, and that's the Lord's truth, goodness knows.

ca: Planyer el bastó malmet el minyó, com diu la Bíblia.
en: Spare the rod and spile the child, as the Good Book says.

ca: Deixo que el pecat s'amuntegui, i pago la pena per tots dos, massa que ho veig.
en: I'm a laying up sin and suffering for us both, I know.

ca: És un vailet endimoniat; pero, caram!, és el noi de la meva germana morta, pobrissona!, i no tinc cor de ventar-li fuetada, sigui com sigui.
en: He's full of the Old Scratch, but laws-a-me! he's my own dead sister's boy, poor thing, and I ain't got the heart to lash him, somehow.

ca: Cada vegada que el deixo anar, la consciencia em puny de allo més; i cada vegada que l'aporrino el cor se'm trenca.
en: Every time I let him off, my conscience does hurt me so, and every time I hit him my old heart most breaks.

ca: Tanmateix, home nat de dona és de pocs dies i ple de tribulacions, com diu l'Escriptura, i és la massíssima veritat.
en: Well-a-well, man that is born of woman is of few days and full of trouble, as the Scripture says, and I reckon it's so.

ca: Fara campana aquesta tarda, i no tindré més remei que fer-lo treballar dema, per a castigar-lo.
en: He'll play hookey this evening, * and [* Southwestern for "afternoon"] I'll just be obleeged to make him work, tomorrow, to punish him.

ca: És ben dur de fer-lo treballar els dissabtes, quan tots els minyons fan festa; pero ell té més rancúnia al treball que a cap altra cosa, i, no hi ha més, he de complir amb ell una mica de la meva obligació, o seré la seva ruina.
en: It's mighty hard to make him work Saturdays, when all the boys is having holiday, but he hates work more than he hates anything else, and I've _got_ to do some of my duty by him, or I'll be the ruination of the child."

ca: Tom va fer campana, i va passar una gentil estona.
en: Tom did play hookey, and he had a very good time.

ca: Torna a casa amb prou feines a temps d'ajudar Jim, el vailet negre, a serrar la llenya del dia següent; i partí les teies abans de sopar, o almenys estigué allí a una hora escaient per a dir ses aventures a Jim, mentre Jim feia les tres quartes parts de la feina.
en: He got back home barely in season to help Jim, the small colored boy, saw next-day's wood and split the kindlings before supper--at least he was there in time to tell his adventures to Jim while Jim did three-fourths of the work.

ca: El germa petit de Tom (o, millor, germanastre), Sid, estava ja enfeinat en la seva contribució al treball (arreplegant les miques de fusta), perque era un noi tranquil, i no pas de mena aventurera ni enquimeradora.
en: Tom's younger brother (or rather half-brother) Sid was already through with his part of the work (picking up chips), for he was a quiet boy, and had no adventurous, trouble-some ways.

ca: Mentre Tom anava menjant-se el seu sopar i robava el sucre en oferir-se-n'hi avinentesa, la tia Polly li feia preguntes que eren plenes d'artifici i molt pregones, perque volia atrapar-lo en revelacions perjudicials.
en: While Tom was eating his supper, and stealing sugar as opportunity offered, Aunt Polly asked him questions that were full of guile, and very deep--for she wanted to trap him into damaging revealments.

ca: Com esdevé a moltes altres animes senzilles, la seva vanitat predilecta era de creure que tenia un talent especial per a l'ombrívola i misteriosa diplomacia, i li plaia de considerar sos enginys més transparents com a meravelles d'extraordinaria trapelleria.
en: Like many other simple-hearted souls, it was her pet vanity to believe she was endowed with a talent for dark and mysterious diplomacy, and she loved to contemplate her most transparent devices as marvels of low cunning.

ca: -Tom- digué ella -feia bastanta calor a l'escola: veritat?
en: Said she: "Tom, it was middling warm in school, warn't it?"

ca: -Sí, senyora.
en: "Yes'm."

ca: -Molta calor: veritat?
en: "Powerful warm, warn't it?"

ca: -Sí, senyora.
en: "Yes'm."

ca: -No teníeu ganes de rabejar-vos una mica a l'aigua, Tom?
en: "Didn't you want to go in a-swimming, Tom?"

ca: Tom es sentí ferit d'un bri d'alarma, d'un toc de sospita inquieta.
en: A bit of a scare shot through Tom--a touch of uncomfortable suspicion.

ca: Escruta la cara de la tia Polly, pero ella no li digué res.
en: He searched Aunt Polly's face, but it told him nothing.

ca: Així és que féu: -No sé…, és a dir, no molt.
en: So he said: "No'm--well, not very much."

ca: La vella senyora estengué la seva ma i toca la camisa de Tom, i digué: -Pero tampoc no esteu massa calent, ara.
en: The old lady reached out her hand and felt Tom's shirt, and said: "But you ain't too warm now, though."

ca: I li fou cosa afalagadora, de reflexionar que ella havia descobert que la camisa era seca, sense que ningú s'adonés que aixo era la cosa que portava al magí.
en: And it flattered her to reflect that she had discovered that the shirt was dry without anybody knowing that that was what she had in her mind.

ca: Pero, a desgrat d'ella, Tom ara sabia d'on venia el vent.
en: But in spite of her, Tom knew where the wind lay, now.

ca: Així és que preveié quína seria la vinent jugada.
en: So he forestalled what might be the next move:

ca: -Alguns de nosaltres ens mullarem el cap sota la bomba… Jo encara el tinc humit.
en: "Some of us pumped on our heads--mine's damp yet.

ca: Veieu?
en: See?"

ca: La tia Polly va enrabinar-se de pensar que havia passat per alt aquell bocí de prova circumstancial i negligit una pista.
en: Aunt Polly was vexed to think she had overlooked that bit of circumstantial evidence, and missed a trick.

ca: Aleshores digué, amb nova inspiració:
en: Then she had a new inspiration:

ca: -Tom: no us calgué pas d'arrencar el coll de la camisa d'alla on jo l'havia cosit, per mullar-vos el cap: oi?
en: "Tom, you didn't have to undo your shirt collar where I sewed it, to pump on your head, did you?

ca: Descordeu-vos el gec!
en: Unbutton your jacket!"

ca: A la cara de Tom s'hi esvaí la preocupació.
en: The trouble vanished out of Tom's face.

ca: Obrí son gec.
en: He opened his jacket.

ca: Son coll de camisa estava solidament cosit.
en: His shirt collar was securely sewed.

ca: -Dolentot!
en: "Bother!

ca: Bé, ja podeu tocar pirandó.
en: Well, go 'long with you.

ca: Estava segura que havíeu fet el plaga i havíeu anat a nedar.
en: I'd made sure you'd played hookey and been a-swimming.

ca: Pero us perdono.
en: But I forgive ye, Tom.

ca: Tom: em fa l'efecte que sou una mena de gat escaldat, com diu la gent… i millor del que sembleu, per aquesta vegada.
en: I reckon you're a kind of a singed cat, as the saying is--better'n you look. _This_ time."

ca: Mig li recava que la seva sagacitat hagués fet fallida, i mig s'alegrava que Tom s'hagués ensopegat, per una vegada, a servar obedient conducta.
en: She was half sorry her sagacity had miscarried, and half glad that Tom had stumbled into obedient conduct for once.

ca: Pero Sidney digué: -Bé, jo diria que li havíeu cosit el coll amb fil blanc; pero ara és negre.
en: But Sidney said: "Well, now, if I didn't think you sewed his collar with white thread, but it's black."

ca: -Oital, si el vaig cosir amb fil blanc!
en: "Why, I did sew it with white! Tom!"

ca: Tom! Pero Tom no n'espera l'acabament.
en: But Tom did not wait for the rest.

ca: En passar la porta, digué:
en: As he went out at the door he said: "Siddy, I'll lick you for that."

ca: -Siddy, aixo et valdra una pallissa. En un indret segur, Tom examina dues grans agulles clavades a les gires del seu gec; i estaven enfilades, l'una enfilada de fil blanc i l'altra de negre.
en: In a safe place Tom examined two large needles which were thrust into the lapels of his jacket, and had thread bound about them--one needle carried white thread and the other black.

ca: -Mai no n'hauria hagut esment, si no hagués estat per Sid.
en: He said: "She'd never noticed if it hadn't been for Sid.

ca: Llamp! De vegades ella ho cus amb fil blanc, i de vegades ho cus amb fil negre.
en: Confound it! sometimes she sews it with white, and sometimes she sews it with black.

ca: Voldria, en nom de Déu, que sempre ho fes amb l'un o amb l'altre: no puc estar tan amatent als canvis.
en: I wish to gee-miny she'd stick to one or t'other--I can't keep the run of 'em.

ca: Pero em jugo qualsevol cosa que a Sid l'estaborniré.
en: But I bet you I'll lam Sid for that.

ca: Li daré una lliçó!
en: I'll learn him!"

ca: Tom no era pas el noi model del poblet.
en: He was not the Model Boy of the village.
